_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FARMERS COOP GRAIN AND SEED
EAST 8TH AND DAVIS AVE N.
THIEF RIVER FALLS,MN 56701

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION CONTACT GARY CLOW FERTILIZER MANAGER 218-681-7583
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN-EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1. THE FACILITY POLICY
           THE OWNERS, MANAGEMNET AND EMPLOYEES OF FARMERS COOP GRAIN AND SEED ARE
COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. IF A
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL
FIRE COMPANY, O R  OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT
OF THE RELEASE TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

2. FACILITY INFORMATION
             THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS
FOR SALE TO FARMERS.
              ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION.
ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS USED FOR CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENTS.
              THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF AMMONIA STORED  WOULD BE 230,000 POUNDS IN OUIR
18,000 GALLON STORAGE TANK AND NURSE TANKS. THE MAXIIMUM QUANTITY HANDLED WOULD
BE UNLOADING OF A TANK TRUCK HOLDING 40,000 POUNDS.

3 THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AND THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO.

           a. THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENAIRO FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA WOULD BE THE RELEASE
OF THE TOTAL CONTENTS OF A STORAGE TANK RELEASED AS A GAS OVER TEN MINUTES. THE 
MAXIMUM QUANTITY RELEASED WOULD BE 80,000 POUNDS WHICH REPRESENTS THE VOLUME OF THE
STORAGE TANK AT 85 PERCENT CAPACITY AS LIMITED BY DESIGN STANDARDS. THE DISTANCE TO
THE ENDPOINT (POINT OF DISPERSION TO 200 PPM) IS .94 MILES.

           b. THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA BASED ON THE HAZARD
REVIEW IS A 2 MIMUTE RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A 3 INCH PIPE.  THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT 
(POINT OF DISPERSION TO 200 PPM) IS .78 MILES.

4. THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVETION PROGRAM.
..
            THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUREMENTS FOR THE
STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1",PUBLISHED

BY THE AMERICAN
NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY
AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF
ANHYDROUS AMMONIA". IN ADDTION, MINNESOTA DEPT OF AG RULES.

 5. THE FIVER-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
             a. THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST
FIVE YEARS THAT:
              HAVE CAUSED AND DEATH, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY;
NOR TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, HAVE RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, SHELTERING IN PLACE, PROPERY DAMAGE OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.

 6. THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.

             THE FACILITY HAS:
 a. A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD, 29 CFR
1910.38;

  b.PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA);

   c.COORDINATED WITH LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONDERS.

  7. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

               SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY. PERIODIC EVALUATIONS
ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENACE OF SAFE CONDITIONS. THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL
SPECIFIC ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
